trans-unit.source: The DirectoryAttributeCollection class contains a collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> objects.
The DirectoryAttributeCollection constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> class.
The Add method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to add.
The zero-based index in the collection where the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> was added.
attribute is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
The AddRange method adds an array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> objects to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> to add to the collection.
attributes is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
A member of attributes is a null reference ( in Visual Basic) or a member of attributes specifies a modification operation other than Add.
The AddRange method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object to the current collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object to add to this collection.
attributeCollection is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

The Contains method determines whether this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object contains a specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object for which to search.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> is part of the collection; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise.
The CopyTo method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

## Exceptions |Exception|Condition| |---------------|---------------| |ArgumentNullException|`array` is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |ArgumentOutOfRangeException|`index` is less than zero.| |ArgumentException|`array` is multidimensional
-or-

The number of elements in the source <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection> is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of the destination `array`.| |InvalidCastException|The type of the source <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection> cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination `array`.|
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of `array` where copying begins.

The IndexOf method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object for which the index is returned.
The index value of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object, if found; otherwise, -1.
The Insert method inserts the specified object into the at the specified index.
The zero-based index point, in the collection, at which to insert the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to be inserted into the collection.
value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic) or value specifies a modification operation other than Add.
index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the object.
The Item property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object at the specified index.
## Exceptions |Exception|Condition| |---------------|---------------| |ArgumentException|You attempted to set the property to `null`.|
The index value of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object at the specified index.
The OnValidate method verifies that value is a object or specifies an add operation.
The object to evaluate.
This exception can occur under one of the following conditions: - value is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
- value is not a object.
The Remove method removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object from the collection.
Exceptions |Exception|Condition| |---------------|---------------| |NotSupportedException|<xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection> is read-only or has a fixed size.|
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to remove.
